sub_topic: Identifying the Eulerian and Hamiltonian paths in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

![Graph with nodes A, B, C, D, E, F and edges shown between them](https://i.imgur.com/djhCIvg.png)

Is there a Hamiltonian path in this graph? If yes, give one example. If not, explain why not.
message_2:
Yes, there is a Hamiltonian path in this graph. A Hamiltonian path is a path that visits each vertex exactly once. One example of a Hamiltonian path in this graph is:

A -> B -> C -> E -> D -> F
